title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consists of 3 interviews. It was pretty easy-going. Just be yourself. But I will say it's easier to get hired through and agency first then be offered a permanent position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years? Why do you want to work for the company? Etc.

title: Senior Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There are multiple interviews and the process can take weeks. They seem pretty thorough and you may need to travel to complete pre employment tasks. Seems like a great place to work.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult patient?

title: Operational Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
Human Resources interviewer was rude and adversarial. Shocking behavior from a gatekeeper. 

An automated email initiated scheduling of my virtual interview with human resources rep within a week of submitting my application.
Interview Questions: Asked about my background and its application to the role.

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: It was 2 rounds of interview, first was with the Lab supervisor, then the second one was with the head of Clinical Research. It was overall very relaxed, they talked about their ongoing project.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, Why are you interested in this position?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Terrible, long, bias, antagonist to POC. After four interviews, I still didn’t get chosen. I spoke to a recruiter, two managers, a Vice President, and a doctor. Even the VP said that the doctor was a piece of work. Very insulting to my time and experience.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Talked with the initial recruiter, then got ghosted. Seems like a common theme of them just ghosting you. Never got a chance to talk to the team. I got assured that I would hear back, then after my follow up I never heard back.
Interview Questions: basic HR stuff questions, nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (Upper East Side) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: This is my experience as someone who works a for the hospital. You apply online, follow up by emailing the recruiter, a interview is extended to you by the service department
Interview Questions: To describe your experience? How do you feel about a role that will evolve in its expectations of workflow

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with multiple departments and it took a long time. Might vary with your role within the company. My experience took a few months. Many different hands in the pot.
Interview Questions: What would you do in this situation?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Not going to lie, it was pretty typical. I did a lot of talking, which I don't normally do but I felt very much confident in my answers. I did get in and it was a great experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Why are you interested in WCM?

title: Grant Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: the process is fast and to point, the process from 1st interview to first day of job took 2 months. Interview questions are reasonable, just friendly chat with direct manager and HR
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position??

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: One weekend, stay at the Bentley hotel, very well planned out and engaging. Graduate students seemed happy and productive in the program, which is always a good sign. The program is very competitive with others in the New York metro area, but student housing options leave a bit to be desired. Students can choose between hundreds of labs at MSK and Cornell, which is a huge bonus. Overall 5/5.
Interview Questions: Many questions from PIs on previous research and future research interests.

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions:
Micro aggressive: I was told my thank you notes were not using the correct, formal tone and was reminded multiple times that Cornell holds Ivy League status. 

Unprofessional: During my interview with the hiring manager’s boss, she answered a text/email while I was in the middle of speaking. 

Writing Sample: submitted and never received feedback yet received feedback on thank notes 

Unnecessarily Long Process: I had a screening with HR, 1 on 1 with hiring manager, 1 on 1 with hiring manager’s boss and panel interview with lateral team members.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you built a relationship with a donor that lead to a positive outcome.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the PI directly and went in person to chat with them and numerous people in the lab. After all the one-on-ones (lasted about 5 hours total) they talked to my references and I received an offer through HR. They asked me about my background, future goals/interests, and previous projects.
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions about the lab?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was pretty smooth Questions were straight forward. I would recommend this organization because the quality of care is five starts. They have good customer service within the H.R dept.
Interview Questions: common questions: how many yrs for experience? Do you enjoy working with patients?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was quick, maybe 15 minutes. They asked about my experience in that past and gave me situations to see how I would handle them. The process was easy and the people were nice,
Interview Questions: How would you handle 2 of your bosses asking for different things?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of two rounds. I was interviewed by the head of the lab first, then by the other Ph.D. students and research assistants later. Everything was done online through Zoom.
Interview Questions: Describe one of my research experience. What techniques can I use? What techniques am I interested in? What projects in the lab am I interested in?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was swift and to the point. They asked basic interview questions regarding productivity. They were very friendly and asked the basic interview questions. I was allowed to ask a few questions at the end.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself?

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
(1) Recruiter; (2) Peers; (3) Management.
Interviews went well but never heard back from them after third interview. I should have contacted them in retrospect in order to get some feedback.
Interview Questions: All the questions were pretty typical and straightforward.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: A recruiter reached out after I applied via Indeed, and we discussed my goals and previous experience. They put my resume in for another position, but there was a long gap in time between our initial conversation and any follow up. Eventually interviewed over three separate times with different members of the team.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous research experience? Greatest Strength?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process and quick call-backs. They had me go through 3 interviews for the Radiology department but after the first one, the remaining two are really for formalities and to see if they like you on a social scale.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work nights and weekends? How would you deal with difficult patients or why do you want to work at Weill Cornell.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. After submitting app, there's a phone screen. You then meet with members of lab in a panel style interview. Then you meet with each PI individually. Not stressful at all
Interview Questions: How do you manage time and prioritize things on a daily basis?

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Met with multiple people in the lab. I got opportunity to ask many questions as well! I appreciated this because it helped me learn more about the fit, culture and types of work i would be doing
Interview Questions: - Why this lab ?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for multiple rounds for multiple labs which lasted about a month. The first round was an interview with a recruiter back in December who then told me I had to wait until April to start applying again because I would be a new grad. The next round was a Zoom call with the PI, and then a Zoom call with the current research assistant. I’m not sure if there were any rounds after that because I was ghosted by all the labs I talked to without any information about next steps.
Interview Questions: What are three words rear describe you?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview process with seminar and meetings with departmental heads and researchers. Received feedback as well as an offer on the same day. Seminar was well attended with focus on application of knowledge to new areas
Interview Questions: Long term goals in scientific field

title: Patient Access Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a very friendly interview. I was asked about my experiences and learned about the positions from the hiring managers. It felt not too intimidating as I was expecting and overall just a friendly exchange
Interview Questions: Describe one of your difficult situations with a patient.

title: Senior Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The experience with the recruiter was the worst I've experienced. Most recruiters are easy to talk to, approachable, and good listeners. When asking this recruiter questions, he/she laughed sarcastically and said that WCM is non-profit and that they don't offer what I had asked. When explaining the benefits, he/she assumed my age and referenced a specific dollar amount which I later realized was an error on her part and that I wouldn't be eligible for. When I was made an offer, I countered the offer and the response was that it's unlikely the dept would agree. There was no communication for a few days whether or not he/she would ask the dept. Her/His emails were three words with terrible punctuation.  She/He was responsive once I declined the offer, at that point she/he called and emailed multiple times. 

The interviewers were all great. Pretty straight forward questions, some about my background and others were behavioral/situational.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for WCM?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very straightforward, friendly, and open to questions. I felt comfortable despite it being my first job interview as a soon to be college graduate.  They're very understanding.
Interview Questions: How does this fit into your future career aspirations?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Quality questions and job description. Interviewers made sure to give me a sense of my day-to-day and responsibilities. Also gave me the opportunity to ask my own questions. I was able to go over every part of my resume that I believe would help me in this position.
Interview Questions: What strengths can you bring in?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Calm, simple, conversational, learned a lot about the role. The PI was really nice, but I'd imagine that the interview would be dependent on the PI. Would recommend to all of my colleagues.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my research experience.

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was seamless and very tailored to the lab you are interviewing for. Questions are specific to the PI/lab you are interested in. Onboarding was really fast after the offer was given.
Interview Questions: Something about preparing dilutions and other lab associated questions

title: Outreach Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was very comfortable, less stressful, allowing free flow of thoughts. They really encouraged an environment for continuous learning. I was a small part of a big team, I was made aware of my roles in our first meeting itself. They allowed me enough time to consider and think about getting on board, as it was an unpaid internship.
Interview Questions:
Q: What are your future goals?
Q: How do you see yourself in next 2 years?

title: Senior Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was standard, my interviewer was nice, informative and attentive to my questions. There will be multiple rounds of interviews with physicians and ultimately resume will be sent to HR for background check and references. Unfortunately due to low compensation, I decided to not move forward.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and do you have any questions for me?

title: GMP Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Had an in person interview first. They talked about the position and asked me to share about my experience. After that, one of the employees gave me a tour around the facilities, showing the work environment, labs, commons areas, etc.
Interview Questions: How long I would be able to commit to the job, asked me for my experience and expectations.

title: clinical research database specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Took three months to get a call for an interview. Went through two rounds, one with the supervisor and one with the assistant director. The first interview wasn't bad, they were honest about the job and respectful. The second interview was pretty condescending. It was obvious that the second interviewer was not interested and was asking some pretty rude questions and was dismissive at times.

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with managers second interview with director 3rd with HR for credentials also for benefits review. The interview process is fairly easy just be yourself. Interview was held over zoom which made it even easier.

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Met with 2 CRCs. About 30 minutes long, basic traditional questions. Not too friendly, and completely ghosted after the interview. Not even a rejection email. Very unprofessional in my opinion.
Interview Questions: Q. What are your strengths/weaknesses.

title: Patient Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went very well. I was interviewed twice. I was asked the basic questions and I definitely did my research before the fact. The questions weren't challenging but it's always always recommended to ask more questions to the interviewer.

title: Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Very informative and detailed process. Employers were on time for the interview. I thoroughly enjoyed learning more about the people who worked there Salary was discussed without issue. I enjoyed speaking with all the team members and was offered a tour of the department. Great experience.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What were your other externships like?

title: Insurance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Straight to the point via zoom. interviewers were kind and professional. Questions were outdated and redundant (2 seperate interviews and they both asked the same exact questions on 2 different days ) and I don't think the questions helped to get a better understanding of me and if I was a good fit but the conversation went alright. It's been 2 weeks and still no word.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had an angry customer

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was basically three rounds of interviews. The initial one was with the division admin and lab manager, the second was with the main principal investigators and the last was with the Chief of the Division.

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews with both the team and directors. After the last interview with the director, there was no more correspondence. Reached out twice to follow-up and never received a response. Unprofessional if you ask me.
Interview Questions: What do you think you would bring to the team?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: A few questions with department manager and then a meeting with the MD you will be working with. Everyone was very nice and it was super easy and relaxing environment.  They ask very basic questions and kept the interview casual
Interview Questions: What is your past experience?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
The first round was with the hiring manager for about 30 min, who will go through your resume generally. You have to be familiar with every experience on your resume, and prepare for questions about your salary expectation and some questions for the organization.
The second round interview will be with the director/supervisor in the lab/department for about 1 hour. You may be asked about "what's your long-term career goal?", "What can you bring to the lab's project?", and specific questions regarding your previous research experience details.
After it, you may have another meeting with other team members.
Interview Questions:
What's your salary expectation?
Why are you interested in the lab?
What's your long-term career goal?
What can you bring to the lab's project?
Questions about your previous research experience (in detail)

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: After applying online the PI reached out to set up an interview. The interview itself was pretty comfortable and it was mainly an introduction to the lab and the lab members.
Interview Questions: Do you have any research experience?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interview was laid back and easy. Asked specific questions about my experience and nothing that stumped me. I felt comfortable and my interviewer was kind and friendly.  One of the best interviews I've ever been invited to attend.
Interview Questions: What made you want to be an MA?

title: Clinical Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2021

Interview Questions:
What is your leadership style?
What is your position on diversity?
How would you handle specific situations?
What is your most challenging issue for you in dealing with working on a treatment team?

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Supervisor Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews and they said that there are three interviews in total for this position and they would contact me in a week. I had a preliminary interview with a current research assistant, a second interview with a researcher, and the third interview with the the project manager I believe. They wanted to see how interested I am in their studies and how similar my previous research assistant jobs were to this one. They said that they required a 2 year commitment to the study as a research assistant and they were looking for a "best fit" candidate, they weren't in a hurry to fill the position.  Each interview was pretty long and they asked a lot of questions because they really wanted a research assistant that's interested in that specific area of psychology research, and my previous experience was in a different area of psychology research.

1. Why I was part of the research study that I previously worked in

3. If I had experience with this demographic

title: Software Engineer Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Physician Assistant Interview

title: Business Analyst Research Administration Interview

Interview Descriptions: Two panel interviews, one with team leads and another with managers. Plenty of open-thinking questions, previous experience related questions, and behavior questions. Overall a good experience with very smart individuals. The interview process can take several weeks to get an answer.
Interview Questions: How do you prefer to communicate?

title: Account Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
It was thru skype. overall a pleasant interview . asked all
the basic interview question like other interviewer. being really accommodating for virtual interview since i am out of town   .
Interview Questions: expected salary

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the position on 8/5/19. I received an email inviting me for an interview by the administrative manager the second week of November. I decided to write this review to show that you shouldn’t give up hope when applying to major hospitals in NYC. In my experience the process is always a long one. 
The interview with the manager was standard, mostly questions about my background, why I thought I was a good fit and an explanation of the position. It went well.  I sent a thank you email the same day and received a reply within an hour to set up the second interview. 
I had a phone interview with the department supervisor the following week.  Again, the interview went well and I received a call that same day to set up the final interview with HR. He asked if I can meet with him that same week and I said yes. 
The final interview with HR they went over salary and benefits. Everything was explained and I was told  that he was going to negotiate salary for me but it was based on my experience and what others in the same role were being paid.  Less than a week later I received a call with an offer. 
I accepted and am now in the process of on boarding.  Weill Cornell requires two ppd tests, so that alone takes two weeks. A little over a month from the first interview to my start date.
Interview Questions: What is something you need to work on?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with divisional supervisor. The panel interview lasted for about 30-45 minutes. The panel asked questions to learn more about your skills and past experience while also gaining insight on how the skills would transfer to the medical secretary job description.
Interview Questions: What are one of your weaknesses?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
My recruitment process took one day shy of an entire month. I had 3 separate interviews with 3 different groups of individual(s).

Initial phone screening 9/23

First interview- 9/25: meet with my direct supervisor and her assistant.

Second interview- 10/11: panel interview meet with the head of department, operations manager and a practice manager.

Third interview- 10/15: meet with an HR representative.

Called back on 10/17 to provide professional references.

Offered position on 10/24 

None of the interviews were extremely hard, my advice is to be your self and have confidence.. all three interviews I was asked to discuss my resume from bottom to top. Give real life scenarios regarding your resume. They want to be able to relate to you and where you have came from within your professional background. 

Even though this was the longest interview process I have ever had, it makes sense on why WC went through so many selection processes to ensure you are the correct fit for the department and company.
Interview Questions: what is something you think you will have difficulty achieving in this role?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Questions about your experiences that would help you in your position, both on resume and not listed on resume.  Asked about your five year plan and a walk thru your resume
Interview Questions: Five year plan?

title: Biller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: 20 mins asks questions about details and background. Past experiences. Describe a difficult situation. Where do you see yourseld in a few years. Describe yourself. Wanted to hire asap. Interview was good.
Interview Questions: Experince in billing

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very enjoyable and quick process. Within two weeks I met with the research team, managers, principal investigators and HR. Meetings were somewhat informal, going over my resume and describing the position.
Interview Questions: Talk to us about your previous research experience.

title: Senior Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
I’ve been interviewing for a senior patient coordinator position. So far, I’ve had four interviews. 
Today, I met with an administrator and my God was her attitude disgusting. 
I couldn’t believe it, because everyone else that I’ve met with were so warm and welcoming. She kept going at me as if I were some kind of convicted criminal and I was very offended by her “I know it all” nature. She even picked on my resume and tried to argue with me over the words “assistants” and “assistance.” Also, she implied that I “run from things” because I didn’t accept a part time offer from a doctor that I interned with. I told her I’m not obligated to accept a job offer because I wasn’t employed at the time. I explained to her that the commute was very expensive, so I was basically working to afford transportation to work and her response? Oh but still you weren’t working so why not. How ignorant. 
I even cried when I got home as to how horrible she treated me. I’ve worked at hospitals before and even at a bank and I’ve never been spoken to like this before. 
I’m going to be reporting this woman. Not sure how she got her job!
Interview Questions: What would the doctor you interned with say about you?

title: Practice Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with ten people over the course of about eleven  days- the ninth and tenth (Human Resources and Practice Administrator) declined based on it not seeming that I was planning on furthering my education. This was a bit disappointing seeing as there was no evidence for those individuals to make that assessment, furthermore, the decision was made the day of my final two interviews, to which I can't help but to wonder why take up one hour, thirty minutes of my time after rearranging my interview schedule less than twenty-four hours prior if you already had your mind made up that I was not a good fit? Terribly disappointing, monumental waste of time, I felt lied to, ultimately, as I was told my degree  status was a non-issue for this role during the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview was held via Skype with the postdoc and the PI. They talked a little about their research and then went on to ask me questions. The interview lasted for about 45 minutes. They sent out a rejection email about one week later.
Interview Questions: Describe your research experience

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

Then each would switch and answer relatively similar questions. Most spent a lot of time looking over my resume and not asking questions.

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Applied via career website and sent resume to PI. Got interview two days later, had to come back to meet PI the following week. After that, HR called and had to go in for an interview--HR interview is essentially a formality, just asked about start date, etc.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by a PhD student in one of the research labs. Had a skype interview a few weeks later that asked about my resume and if I knew basic info about what the lab was studying. At the end of that interview I was then invited for an in-person interview two weeks later. There I met members of the lab and at the end of the interview was asked to give a few references. Three weeks went by and I heard nothing  from the person I was initially contacted by. I decided to send an email asking about the status of the position and received a response saying I was a top candidate but they went with someone who had more prior research experience than me. I am annoyed and irritated that they didn't even bother to contact me to let me know that I didn't receive the position. If I didn't email them I would have never gotten a response back. Also this was an entry level position with no experience required. I just didn't like how they acted and it was not professional at all to drag someone along like that waiting for a response for weeks after a second interview.
Interview Questions: What is your 5 year plan?

Multiple interviews

title: Customer Service Representative Interview

title: Senior Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Got an interview through a staffing agency, which got me an interview. They emailed my resume to a manager and I got a call later that same day for an interview the next day. The manager on the phone mentioned to bring extra copies of my resumes because I might be meeting with other managers. Never mentioned that I would be walking to different sites all over the Upper East Side. I was under the impression it was all in the same building. My first interview was in the 55th street location, then he told me to meet with another manager on 61st street, then she sent me to 70th street. Never had an experience like that. I believe they should just have all interviews at one location otherwise they need to provide some bus fare or something to go to the other sites. All interviews were the same: questions about experience from resume, why I want to work for the company, etc. The final site I interviewed with one manager who, after our interview, told me I would be meeting with another person and had me wait in the waiting area for over 15 mins until they came back and told me I had to come in another day to meet with the other person. Okay fine. Overall, the process took way longer than I had expected. They should be more transparent about the duration of the interview process.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Cornell?

The first section was with the direct manager and the second was with the current staff. Interview questions were generic and focused mainly on lab safety. Did not get the job but i wish the staff there would have acted more professional. I expected more from the staff in a big institution, to at least have the decency to inform the candidates if they didn't make the cut. I left the interview with a good impression but ended up ghosted by the whole department. "We will have HR send over employment forms by the end of the week" turned into HI ITS BEEN 6 MONTHS NOW WHERE ARE THE FORMS!!!

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions:
I applied directly with the PI (Principal Investigator) and was called in for an interview about a week later. Trying to apply through HR is a complete waste of time. I met with the PI only, and the interview revolved around my undergraduate coursework and prior research experience. I brought a copy of the paper where some of the research I contributed to had been published.

But the PI wanted a minimum two year commitment to the position. There was also the expectation that I share his level of interest in the research, meaning working nights and weekends. And since Research Technician positions are grant funded, the low salary being offered was all I would be paid. With all the expected overtime, it would basically work out to minimum wage. And since Research Technician positions are grant funded, the PI couldn't guarantee me job security even if I wanted to stay two years. If his future grant proposals were rejected by NIH, NSF, etc., there would be no money. There were no promotions or decent salary increases in the pipeline either. It was basically a terminal position with small cost of living increases at the most.

I received an email from the PI about a month later letting me know the position had been filled. But I knew from the interview that it wasn't going to work out. The job description doesn't exactly advertise it, but it basically only works if you intend to go to medical school in a few years. And you need to come from a rich family, because the non-negotiable salary isn't enough to live on in New York City.
Interview Questions: Can you make a two year commitment?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted about a month after I applied via email. After answering a few introductory questions, I was called in for an interview. Met with PI and several members of the lab. All were very kind, and the conversations were mostly about the research being done at the lab. I followed up, and about two weeks later the PI let me know the position had gone to someone else.

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Multiple phone and in person interviews. Time consuming process due to the number of on-site interviews required. Everyone on the teams I spoked to seemed knowledgeable and like good people to work with. Most had been there for years. The actual interviews went well which made overlooking the logistical issues of the process possible.

The problem is their internal communication amongst each other (HR, teams, Directors) is poor. For example one is completely unaware that you've already been on-site to interview multiple times.

I had interviews rescheduled on me for which i took vacation from my job for and I wasn't notified until shortly before the scheduled interview. They are not intentionally inconsiderate but just too preoccupied to be aware of the fact that you have a job and need to allocate money and time to meet with them.

Additionally they were not on the same page in terms of the salary they were willing to offer for this position. Which led to confusion come offer time as the range discussed on two separate occasions two months prior was never even feasible despite it being conveyed that the manager was aware and ok with the range.  And we are talking a 30% differences from the bottom end of that range to the offer. This resulted in me being led to believe there was a lot more money to be offered then was and as a result, led to both sides basically wasting each others time interviewing in the first place.

Lastly, after complimenting all of those I met with and the organization I was treated rudely by the HR recruiter (i literally just complimented that person as well) who became upset when I rejected the offer and proceeded to explain all the reasons why they were unable to offer more which was basically a list of reasons not to work there. I was not upset that they could not offer more. The market for the position is what it is. what bothered me was that this could have all been avoided. I tried to convey that in hopes it would provide a change in their process so someone else could avoid this problem but it was not heard as like I said the HR recruiter was too upset to listen. I ended the call professionally once this happened and that was that. A lot of time wasted, and if they had their internal communication better organized we could have stopped the process after the first call.

Again I will reiterate that the people on the teams seemed like good people to work with. I would recommend anyone interviewing verify the potential salary early on and confirm that the person you are talking to is in fact knowledgeable of the salary range and has authority to communicate that range. Because I did on two occasions and then come offer time was disappointed and felt as if my time was wasted.
Interview Questions: General interview questions related to job tasks, and why you are looking to move.

Most thorough interview process I have ever been through. I was initially contacted in November 2013 and was still interviewing in March 2014 before I stopped the process to take another offer. I would've written sooner but I just learned of this website. 

I was contacted by a really excellent recruiter who sat with me and went over my goals and what I was looking for working at Weill Cornell. She set me up to participate in their interview event, which was kind of like speed dating. There were tables set up with several different departments that were all looking to hire (at least 10 departments there). You sit with each hiring manager(s) for 5 minutes and they ask you quick questions and information. Based off of this, the recruiter contacts you afterward with the departments that would like to meet with you again. 

This is good, because it helps you line up a couple of interviews within the same organization. My only issue was that the hiring process was taking a long time. I am used to having to do only 1, maybe 2 interviews before getting a yes or a no. Their process is extensive. They want you to meet with everyone in the department to make sure you're a good fit for everyone. You have to be really patient if you're interested in this organization. After 4 months of interviewing and callbacks, I finally pulled the plug it was taking way too long and in the meantime another company extended a similar offer. 

Interview questions were pretty standard, but prepare to meet with a panel on more than one occasion. It was not a negative experience in any form, but it's draining.
Interview Questions: Standard interview questions for an administrative role, be prepared to talk in detail about the work experiences you have done that relate to the position.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviews for management and leadership positions. Conversational style. How would you approach a given situation. Many standard HR questions. What would your colleagues say about you. What would you superiors say about you. What would you change about prior supervisors. What is your management style. Interviews are spread over two or three visits. Interviews may be designed to see how much stamina you have. Evaluation in more than one social situation.
Interview Questions: How will you manage communications and competing objectives between all of the collaborating organizations that partner with the institution.

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: initially called by recruiter. scheduled me for panel interview. met with the head of the department, the practice manager, a person currently in the role and the recruiter. the panel interview was somewhat intimidating but the recruiter controlled the whole situation initiating questions about my experience and allowing me to answer..
Interview Questions: behavior questions, talked about previous experiences & gave examples

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: depending on the professor. usuallu the human resource will select the C.V. first and pick 3 to 5 potential candidate for interview, you will be notice by the human resource directly, and then it will depend on how the lab manager do. if u been picked for the interview, you usually will meet all the members of the lab, and take a tour of the lab environment, after that, u will be notice if u r recruited to the second round.
Interview Questions: nothing specific difficult, just be professional about your job

title: Animal Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was simple and straight forward. Interview times are flexible and they are a day full of interviews with you and different people in management.You receive a walk through of the facility as well.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a co-worker that was not doing their job?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Hiring was a two-tiered process.  I was first interviewed by the lab's Principal Investigator (PI), then by HR at Cornell.  The PI's questions were related to previous lab experience and techniques, while HR asked the more standard interview questions.  All in all, everyone was very communicative and supportive throughout the process, and I have no complaints.
Interview Questions: Most difficult question was related to a scientific technique that I learned a few years back, asked by the lab's PI.  Mostly to check critical thinking skills and scientific acumen.

title: Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: There were 3 interviews. The first was completed over the phone. I was then asked to come in person for the interview and lastly I was interviewed by HR.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult or unexpected questions during the interview.

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I received a call from HR to interview.  Went to interview with department dean, a post doc, and several M.D./profs.  I was told they are looking to fill the position quickly.

Almost all have an M.D., not some kind of statistics degree, so, if you are a stat expert, do use simple terms even if you know about, do not bore everyone.

The interviewers talked about medical related things, which I don't know.  I have some great ideas building statistical models, but I didn't get to express that.  I don't think they are interested in knowing.

I wish they asked something simple but concrete, like how do you build a regression model.  I'd have a lot to say.
Interview Questions: Do you know SAS?

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: One day interview with all the members of the department
Interview Questions: No difficult questions. They already screened you.

title: Graduate Student Biomedical Sciences Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed in 2 different departments in the graduate school which translated to 6 interviews on super day. Had a combination of behavioral and technical questions as well as asked to give an impromptu presentation of my past research. Make sure to do background reading on all your interviewers, and be prepared to discuss your future research endeavors.
Interview Questions: An interviewer described her research in about 5 sentences then asked me to propose the next steps that should be done.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very informal and was in actuality more of an information session. Was told not to bother feigning interest in the interviewer's research. Was sent along to see two other people in another building - both meetings went very well, but I was never called. Nor were my emails inquiring to the position's status answered.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I just had an interview with the lab and everything went well. I was interviewed by the person who I was going to work with and also by other lab members as well as the PI. However, the PI only had 5 minutes to talk to me. The lab seemed really stiff in terms of social interaction. It just didn't felt like home since I will be spending majoring of my time there.
Interview Questions: They just asked what kind of research skills I had and my experience in my current lab and why I wanted to work there. I also got a math quiz which was quite unexpected.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions:
initial CV review, followed by skype interviews with the PI and then interaction with the lab members. It was an advertised position. 
The work was although not related to my previous work, I expressed the interest and a knowledge of the subject.
Interview Questions: The interview was focused on my previous research work. How I solved problems and how I plan to work in the prospective lab. This is the typical postdoc hiring process. There was also the review from the lab members involved, who found me positive.

title: Senior Patient Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Pretty standard
Interview Questions: They really don't ask questions. They ask if you have questions,and you always should.

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: call for interview within one week of initial application. The interview was one on one with department manager, very straight forward, honest, and personable. Questions were not out of the ordinary. Strong emphasis placed on people skills and personality to create a team that works well together and efficiently.
Interview Questions: Questions pertaining to personality and ability to contribute to the ever changing work environment.

title: MD-PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: 1 day interview, multiple faculty from Cornell, Rockefeller, and MSKCC as well as Tri-Insititutional MD-PhD program specific administrators. Dinner beforehand and afterwards with social outing as well. Rigorous interview questions that were specifically focused on research background.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do MD and PhD?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: standard and friendly
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Called by an HR recruiter, they did an initial phone interview to see where I would best be fit. I was scheduled for an interview with the Medical Director of the corresponding department and the Department Supervisor. After the interview I was called with a job offer.
Interview Questions: How do I handle conflicts with other coworkers.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively simple and straightforward. My prospective mentor and I scheduled a time to meet in his office, and he described what the role would entail. He then detailed what I would be doing as a clinical research assistant under him and then proceeded to ask me some questions about my previous experience and my overall goal in life.
Interview Questions: "Why do you want to do medicine?"

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter reached out and asked me to submit my resume. She forwarded it to those that needed graduates to fill research positions. Had an interview with (current boss) and head of research activities, short interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews were required. One with HR and one with the lab that I was attempting to work for. The HR one asked the standard questions any interviewer would ask you whereas the lab one was more of a "get to know you" and inquired about your skills.
Interview Questions: What are your long term plans? Where will you be in 5 years?

title: Non-Clinical Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, panel interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here and/or this position?

title: Senior Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: I work with Weill Cornell so I submitted my application online. I received a response and then was scheduled an interview date.  I asked questions during the interview.  My notification from Human Resources came in a few weeks.  Then I had to go through the orientation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Project Manager II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed concerning artifacts and process.  There were many questions concerning ability and appetite for a heavy workload.  Also, they were honest about the less than ideal work environment though they could have in no way prepared me for how bad it was.
Interview Questions: What type of artifacts have you used?  Show examples.

title: Postdoctoral Associate In Cell and Developmental Bio Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met PI at conference, wrote letter post meeting, invited for interview and was offered the same day. Was given time to interact with everyone in the lab, taken out for lunch.
Interview Questions: Would you like to stay in academia?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
3 interviews: one with assistant director, one with chief physician of division, one with HR

The interviews are fairly informal.  The assistant director may vet you for a second or two to ensure you are worth scheduling for meetings with the physicians (these are insanely busy people).  The interview with the physicians will likely be quick.  If you get to HR, you are essentially as good as hired but don't be a jerk.  I have heard of several people having their offers rescinded after talking down to the HR specialists.
Interview Questions: Interview is fairly open.  They essentially want to ensure you 1) have a brain 2)aren't going to use it to do crazy things

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Initial contact and coordination of interview was smooth and easy. The main interviewer was nice and asked questions that are general but clearly stated. Peer interviewers were not as friendly. Topics discussed were not related to the position nor about applicant. Reluctant to provide information on the position and work environment.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position when you already interned for this position before. Have you not have enough of it?

title: Senior Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Went to a staffing agency. the staffing agent had this position open the next day so I went in and started working. the office manager asked a few questions and took me to train. not much to it when you go through an agency, they hire a lot of people from agencies for all positions.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself?

title: Research Program Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was a personal contact out to Cornell that led to further discussions.  In oncology it is all about personal contacts.  It was finalized in a relatively short time once I had decided it was a good career move for me.
Interview Questions: None really.  It was a good fit.

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty standard. Over the phone and in person with multiple people.  We reviewed my resume and I talked about my education and work experiences. The people I met with were nice and I thought the process was straight forward.
Interview Questions: How would you describe your level of organization and attention to detail?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: Application via email followed by interview on skype involving a 45 minute presentation of your research work and discussion on it.
Interview Questions: The interview was kind of easy. Only general questions on your past research experience were asked.

title: Departmental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication was over the phone.  I was called in to meet with my direct supervisor, and then was asked to come back and meet with another supervisor with a laterally equivalent position.  The interview was very much straightforward and basic.  Questions revolved around level of organization and ability to handle internal customer service.  Office culture was very quiet and congenial, very straightforward in terms of describing the position and expectation.  interviewers probing more for commitment than anything else.  What are your plans in the next two years?  What are your professional aspirations? Hiring process was straightforward as well, asked to undergo testing (typing test) and then received an offer within 2 weeks.  Very streamlined process.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interviewee must exude confidence during the interview and demonstrate a strong knowledge of life sciences. Many Principal investigators (PI) seek graduates that are either pre-med or preparing for a physicians assistant program.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have writing an NIH grant?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a cover letter and resume online, and was called for an interview at a Career Day along with other biomedical research institutions in NYC. The interviewer seemed aloof and disinterested.
Interview Questions: What was the last book you read?

title: Computer Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: There was just one interview, having a few years experience in IT was key for this job. During the interview I just stood keen and made sure to use tech savvy words to display my knowledge in the field.
Interview Questions: Questions will revolve around your history in IT. Most likely it will be a troubleshooting question about a computer or printer. If you were picked for an interview, most likely you have at least 2 years experience in the field and should be able to answer with ease.

title: Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met boss at networking event. He invited me to come in and apply for another open position, which I didn't end up getting. After interviewing with the department, I was hired as a temp for a different role. When I was on-boarded as a full-time regular employee, I had to go in to interview with HR.
Interview Questions: Do you feel comfortable dealing with difficult or strong-minded people?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was hired thru a recruiter and HR. They have changed that process now and hire people directly. Very difficult to know who is in charge. My recruiter did a thorough interview, but now they do not use HR anymore.
Interview Questions: None. all routine.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview went great, at least I thought. I was interviewed by the lab head and another researcher. Both went well. I sent a thank you note to both. Two weeks later I was informed that someone else had gotten the position. I at least appreciated being told in a timely manner instead of two months later.
Interview Questions: What is a mole and do you remember avaogadros #?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Extremely detail-oriented. Be prepared to deliver original diplomas. All employees need to be screened for tuberculosis as a condition of employment. There is a 90-day probation period, as well, but orientation in thorough and professional.
Interview Questions: What did your last supervisor find lacking in your performance?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process, quick background check. one on one questions and group interview as well. Nice facility, clean and easy to find on the WES. HR office is not in the same building so it can become a pain to find. I went during construction, so signs were not clear. NO parking offered.
Interview Questions: How do you engage with cross functional groups?

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the PI and two research techs of a cancer research lab. The interviews were one-on-one and focused on research skills as well as personality. About two weeks later, I was interviewed by a HR Recruiter who was polite. We focused on character and personality as he seemed less interested about research.
Interview Questions: What is a situation where you had to dispute something over the phone?

title: Research Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Laid back interview. First met with laboratory group. If you get an HR interview you have the job. Interviews were very laid back. Just went over my resume and relevant experiences.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your research

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: First step involved a phone interview and then followed by an onsite interview. Overall the experience was positive. Lot of the questions dealt with knowledge of techniques and basically how quick you can get off the ground. Very fare questions and nothing too much out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: question dealt with previous research projects

title: Data Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted by division manager. Received email describing position, if I was interested in meeting him to learn more. Scheduled interview about 3 weeks after initial email.  Division manager brought me to the cafe, where we sat waiting for woman who would be my immediate supervisor, she arrived late and was very cold the whole time, made minimal eye contact and seemed pretty angry the whole time. Division manner was very nice, made small talk and described very in depth my position. Took me on a tour of the space where I would potentially be located (space was not allocated at time of interview). Immediate supervisor did not say a word through the tour, then left in the middle of interview. After I was taken to the exit, division manager said he would be in touch, heard nothing for about 2-3 weeks, then an HR recruiter contacted me for an interview conducted by HR. He was more thorough, typical interview conducted by an HR professional, but slightly obnoxious. Asked what I wanted to make, said he didn't foresee it being an issue but ultimately would be up to the divisional manager, said he would be in touch, at this time he requested references. Received phone call about 2 weeks later with offer, and salary. Accepted over the phone and received email 10 minutes later with acceptance paperwork, and to schedule orientation. Had to come into HR office with agreement and diploma or transcript for highest education completed.
Interview Questions: Describe a workplace challenge you've faced?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Called and interviewed by the Psychologist- senior investigator. She spoke about the research project the majority of the interview. Only asked familiarity and experience with SPSS and experience with elderly populations.
Interview Questions: experience with spss?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview - too many personal questions - age, marital status.  1:1 interview with HR head, her persistence in irrelevant questions was unnerving.  Dissatisfied with my responses to her question about where else I was interviewing, she repeated herself 3 times.  Thus, I suggested the inappropriateness of her question.
Interview Questions: how old am I?

title: Research Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: HR recruiter emailed me, arranged a interview time.  They specifically request I bring a transcript or diploma of my highest degree attained and some other standard paperwork (references, etc.).  Filled out a redundant application form which took 15-20min.  The interview itself was casual, no difficult questions per se, straight forward.  Talked about 30 minutes about my past positions.
Interview Questions: What would my last supervisor say that I needed to work on to improve performance?

title: Patient Billing Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: After I was contacted for an in-person interview, I was told I would be contacted by HR.  That took about 40 days to actually happen - leaving me mostly wondering if I even had the job.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions.

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Basic Interview, strengths weakness etc.
Backround check seemed to be a lengthy process took over a month if I recall accurately
Interview Questions: Asking history of Weill Cornell

title: Assistant Research Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: The interview was between the director of the department and myself. We had worked in close proximity for a long while and a position was opening up in a new laboratory. I suggested that I should be the one to take the position (I had been working as a post-doctoral associate).
Interview Questions: Why are you the best person for the job

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Must go through lots of red tape involved with any big hospital operation, including the classic HR BS.  Candidates will likely have a meaningful interview with the chief of their laboratory, so there will be great variety in the specifics.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was the phone interview.
Interview Questions: About my future plan

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Weill Cornell Medicine (New York, NY) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions:
- The first interaction was a phone interview that can be intimidating. You are asked a variety of technical and behavioral questions. They were concerned with your poise and ability to think critically rather that a right / wrong answer.
- The in-person interview was even more rigorous, with more weight on behavioral type questions. The interviewer was inviting and created a comfortable atmosphere.
- The last interview, involved HR screener. They asked a line of questioning surrounding your intentions and your legitimacy of your resume.
(They do contact your references and previous employers)
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 2 years?
